entry.title: Data transfer from multiple models to one common model in SAC Planning
entry.content:
Hi Expert,

We’ve created four separate models in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC). At the story level, we’ve blended these models using common dimensions aligned with a primary model.

However, when we attempt to perform calculations involving measures from multiple models, SAC throws errors — even when using functions like resultlookup

As a workaround, we’d like to consolidate data from all four models into a single common model. This would allow us to calcualtions

Model A -- Emp No,Status,srvdate,company code,FRSPla,FRS Rate hrlyrate,salary etc....
ModelB--  BenefitRate,FRS Plan,FRS Rate
MoodelC--Company code, FiscalYear, YrsSRVfrom,YsrSRV TO
ModelD- EmpNo,Leave Type,Fiscal year,leave type ,leave yeast, Blc hrs 
ModelE- Empno,Leavetype.fyYear,leave type leave yr

Primary model has more dimensions which is not in othe models,

Can anyone advise on the best approach to achieve this?

entry.title: Re: Fundamentals clean core
entry.content:
Hi @Mahmoud__Zeidan 

To ensure you have a clean core from scratch in your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition system, here are the programs, tools, and approaches you should use:

  1. SAP Activate Methodology & Best Practices
  • Start your project with SAP Activate and leverage SAP Best Practices scope items for industry-standard business processes and test scripts.
  • Only activate the minimum necessary scope items to avoid unused features and data
  1. SAP Central Business Configuration
  • Use SAP Central Business Configuration for end-to-end configuration, controlling what business functions you use, and keeping tight control over your solution footprint.
  • Carefully define your organizational structure and master data for example plants, sales organisations and company codes to avoid unnecessary complexity.
  1. Standard Tools and Transactions for Core Maintenance
  • SPRO: Only make necessary customizations via SAP standard configuration and not custom code whenever possible.
  • SU01/SU10: User and role management, use template users as suggested in the starter guide.
  • Fiori Rapid Activation: Rapidly activate only needed apps and services.
  1. Custom Development Practices
  • Follow keep the core clean principles
  • Use in-app extensibility Fiori app Custom Fields and Logic for minor adaptations.
  • Use SAP Business Technology Platform side-by-side extensions for more complex enhancements. Avoid custom ABAP in the core when possible.
  • Document all custom developments and ensure they use released APIs and extension points.
  1. Monitoring and Housekeeping
  • Regularly review transaction codes, custom objects, and roles to remove obsolete items.
  • Use SAP Focused Run or ALM tools to monitor system health and integrations.
  • Perform regular security, data privacy, and authorization audits via security transactions and Fiori launchpad tools.
  1. Data & Integration Clean-up
  • Only interface or integrate with essential systems using SAP standard integration methods (e.g., OData services, SAP Cloud Connector).
  • Ensure all master and transactional data migrated is validated, deduplicated, and relevant.

 

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Implementing SAP S/4HANA Service

Starter system for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition: Getting Started Guide

entry.title: Re: Issue with Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge in Adva...
entry.content:
Hello @aravindrawat 

The error Copying Requirement 304 that you are experiencing occurs because the Reason for Rejection is not set on the return item in the sales order. Unlike the on-premise system, where you can manually change this field (using transaction codes like VOV7/VFBS), SAP S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition manages this automatically.

Explanation:

In the S4 Public Cloud, the system automatically determines the Reason for Rejection based on the follow-up activity chosen during the returns process.
For example, when you select Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge (activity 0002) as the follow-up, the system assigns the relevant rejection reason, marking the item as not billing relevant.
If the rejection reason is missing or not properly assigned, the SD processing step fails with the requirement 304 error.

Next Steps:

  • Please review and update the configuration under SSCUI 105513 – Define Logistical Follow-Up Activities.
  • Make sure a valid Reason for Rejection is assigned to follow-up activity 0002 Subsequent Delivery Free of Charge
  • Once set up correctly, the system will update this field automatically during processing, enabling the SD step to proceed smoothly.

Additional Notes:

  • This mechanism aligns with the standard process model in S/4HANA Cloud and eliminates the need for manual rejection reason entry in sales documents.
  • Direct manual modifications to this field in the sales order are not supported in the cloud edition.

For further details, you can refer to:

  • Logistical Follow-Up Activities - SAP Help Portal

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Cost Center Splitting Weights Integrated Financial Pl...
entry.content:
Hello @SANA11 

Based on the details provided, here are the Root Cause to the issue you are facing:

  • The % Splitting Weight you see is derived from a calculated measure based on a restricted measure
  • When you add or edit the restricted measure in the story, even without changing parameters SAC re-evaluates the calculation context.
  • The recalculation changes depending on:
  1. Versioning context for example Plan vs. Actual
  2. Filters or dimension hierarchies in the story vs. model
  3. Whether “Enable Constant Selection” is checked or unchecked in the calculation editor.

This is why you see the percentage changing when you edit or add the measure. The context shifts and SAC recomputes the formula.

 

Here is how i suggest fixing It

Step 1: Check Calculation Context

In the Calculation Editor:

  1. Go to Measures → Subtotal Driver 2.
  2. Ensure constant selection is enabled for Version (you seem to already have this, so it is good).
  3. Do the same for Splitting Weight if required.
  4. Save and recheck the story.

 

Step 2: Validate the Restricted Measure

  • Make sure Subtotal Driver 2 has the same restrictions in the story as in the model:
    • Go to Model → Measures → Subtotal Driver
    • Compare restrictions for example Cost Center Activity Type, Version and Driver Source.
    • If the story level measure uses different filters, SAC recalculates.

 

Step 3: Lock the Version

  • If your calculation should always be based on the Plan version:
  1. In the Calculation Editor, explicitly select Version = Plan.
  2. Confirm Enable Constant Selection is enabled so other story filters do not override it.

 

Step 4: Compare Story vs. Model Behaviour

  • If the model shows 50% but the story shows a different % after editing, it means
    • Your story filters or dimension drilldowns are overriding model restrictions.
    • To stabilize values, replicate the model calculation context exactly in the story.

SAP suggested best practice: Always manage restricted measures in the model, not in the story, when using standard content, otherwise SAC treats it as a new calculation.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Query on Advanced Return Management for Service and N...
entry.content:
Hello @aravindrawat 

The error “Invalid Movement Type 657” occurs because ARM is designed for stock-relevant processes materials:

  • Movement Type 657 is used for returns-to-stock in ARM.
  • Service items (TATX) and NLAG (non-stock, e.g. KLN) do not involve inventory postings.
  • When ARM tries to post a goods movement, there is no stock, so the process fails.

In response to your question: It is not possible to use Advanced Returns Management for Service or NLAG items.

Possible Workaround:

  • Process these returns using a standard return order (without ARM), referring to the original invoice.
  • Exclude ARM flows such as automatic delivery or credit memo.

SAP Knowledge Base Article on Movement Type 657 in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 

This is standard system behaviour in S/4HANA Cloud, Public Edition and not a configuration error.

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: How to relay custom headers in SAP CALM alerts and pa...
entry.content:
Hello @IKhurana 

Thank you for your question.

Yes, you can leverage custom header details from SAP Integration Suite in SAP Cloud ALM alerts and include your business specific data such as Sales Order numbers or Purchase Order numbers in the incidents created in ServiceNow.

How is how you can achieve this:

  1. Pass Custom Business Data in Integration Suite:
    • In your integration flows on SAP Integration Suite, capture and propagate the custom header or message attributes containing business data.
    • Ensure that these details are included in the event payload when raising alerts or events from Integration Suite.
  2. Configure SAP Cloud ALM Alert Management:
    • Within SAP Cloud ALM, configure the alert rules and payload mapping to extract these custom fields from the incoming event messages.
    • Extend or enrich the alert content by mapping these business data fields into the alert description or custom fields.
  3. Integrate SAP Cloud ALM with ServiceNow Incident Management:
    • Use SAP Cloud ALM’s Event Integration or API-based integration methods to forward alerts to ServiceNow.
    • In the integration, ensure that the mapped alert payload that includes your business context is pushed to create enriched ServiceNow incident records.
    • This can be configured with SAP Integration Suite or native SAP Cloud ALM connectors or custom webhook configurations.
  4. Use SAP Cloud ALM Extensions or Custom Logic:
    • If necessary, use extension capabilities within SAP Cloud ALM or additional SAP Integration Suite flows to format and include business-relevant metadata in the incident creation call.

Integrate SAP Cloud ALM with External Incident Systems

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Report for sales order milestone billing plans in S4H...
entry.content:
Hello @Haily 

You are correct, SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud does not offer a single standard report that consolidates milestone billing plan details, such as Sales Order, Billing Plan, Billing Status, and Billing Amount, all in one place.

Available options in Public Cloud:

  • App Manage Billing Plans F2824
    This app displays billing plan details, including dates, amounts, and status.
  • App Manage Sales Orders – Version 2 (F3893)
    Provides a transactional view useful for order tracking, but does not offer a consolidated billing plan report.
  • App Manage Billing Documents (F0797A)
    Provides information about invoice and billing statuses.

Best Practice for Reporting:

  • Utilise pre-delivered CDS views like I_SalesOrderBillingPlanItem and I_BillingDocumentItem.
  • Create a Custom CDS View that joins sales order billing plan data with billing document data.
  • Expose this data via a Custom Analytical Query and consume it through:
    • Fiori apps (custom analytical tiles),
    • SAP Analytics Cloud dashboards, or
    • Excel via OData services.

This approach is fully supported in the Public Cloud environment and is upgrade safe.

Here are some helpful SAP documentation references you might find useful.:

  • SAP Help Portal: Manage Billing Plans - Convergent Invoicing
  • SAP Community Blog: Project Billing for Customer Projects

Let me  know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Is there a way to generate a requote only with the ad...
entry.content:
Hello @Ingrid_at_Applium 

You are correct that in S/4HANA Public Edition, the Requote function always generates a completely new quotation with all accepted items. Currently, there is no out-of-the-box option or extensibility to create a follow-up quotation that includes only the new items.

The recommended workaround is to create a new quotation for the incremental items and link it to the original using the document flow, so the relationship is visible to both customer and internal users.

Raising this as a Customer Influence request is the right next step, as it is not covered by the current solution.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: SAP Signavio - Cosmetic configuration of shapes in Va...
entry.content:
Hi @alessandro_monticosta 

Thank you for your question.

Here is how you can Turn Off Shadows on Chevron Process Shapes

  • Currently, there is no direct toggle for shadows on chevron shapes in the standard Value Chain diagram editor. However, shadows and other effects are often part of the default style applied to process elements.
  • Here is a workaround: Upload a custom SVG shape without shadows and assign it to your process shapes:
    • Navigate to the Custom Graphics tab in your workspace setup.
    • Upload your custom SVG without shadow effects.
    • Assign this custom graphic to your chevron process shape on the diagram.
  • This effectively replaces the shadowed shape with your solid design.

 

How to Remove Gradient Fill on Rectangles and Have Solid Colour Fill

  • The gradient fill comes from the default style or theme applied to rectangle shapes.
  • Modify this by using custom styles or overriding the fill property:
    • In the diagram’s Attributes panel, check if you can specify a flat solid fill colour overriding the gradient.
    • If not available directly, use a custom SVG shape with your desired solid fill colour.
  • You can also try to adjust the diagram’s global theme settings or create a new colour palette without gradients.

I am happy to help if you have further questions. See links below for further details.

Best regards

Chris

 

Custom Graphics

Custom Process Modelling with Solution Processes

Value Chains

entry.title: Re: Delivery group functionality in Sales order item leve...
entry.content:
Hello @S0026934150 

Thank you for providing the screenshot. In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud version 2502, the Delivery Group (VBAP-GRKOR) field does not initiate outbound delivery splits. It is only used to group items for delivery together; it does not influence how delivery splits are managed.

Here's why your delivery wasn't split

The delivery split logic in Public Cloud relies on the following standard header-level criteria that determine delivery creation and division,

  • Shipping Point
  • Ship-to Party
  • Delivery or Requested Date/Time
  • Route, Incoterms, or other predefined header-level attributes

The VBAP-GRKOR field isn't included in this logic, so it's not possible to set it up or modify it to trigger delivery splits.

What you can do to get separate deliveries:

  • Assign different values to one or more supported fields, such as varying requested delivery dates, shipping points, or routes for the respective items.
  • Alternatively, the system will generate a single outbound delivery, which you can split manually after creation if needed.

Here are some helpful SAP Documentation References that you might find useful.

  • SAP Knowledge Base Article (KBA) confirming this behaviour:
    KBA 3285286 – Delivery Split During Delivery Creation in S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition
    SAP Support Portal - KBA 3285286
  • SAP Community discussions on delivery split criteria:
    Outbound Delivery Split Criteria and Convergence

Let me know if you need further support

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Setting Default Values in RAP Entity Creation: Default Values Functions, Actions, and Augmentation
entry.content:
Setting default values when creating a new entity is a common requirement in RAP-based application development. Currently, there are three options available: Default Values Function, Default Factory Action, and Augmentation. In this blog post, I will walk through the implementation of each technique and explain when to use them. 

Quick Comparison of Defaulting Options in RAP

Here is a summary of the three options for setting default values in RAP entity creation.

 

Default Values Function

Default Factory Action

Augmentation

Can set default values for the root entity?

✔

✔

✔

Can accept parameters?

✖

✔

✖

Can create child entities along with the root entity?

✖

✔

✔

Can set defaults when creating a child entity independently?

✔

✖

✔

 

When to Use Each Approach

  • Default Values Function: Best when you want to set static default values. “Static” here still allows values depending on runtime context, such as the logged-in user, the current date, values from related entities.

  • Default Factory Action: Use this when defaults need to be determined dynamically based on user input. It can also create child entities together with the root entity. However, it cannot be used for creating child entities independently; in that case, use a Default Values Function or Augmentation.

  • Augmentation: This is defined at the projection layer, not at the base behavior definition. It is mainly useful when you cannot or do not want to change the base behavior.

 

Notes on Combining the Methods

These methods cannot be combined for the same entity. 

  • Default Values Function + Augmentation → Both are called, but only the values from the Default Values Function are applied.

  • Default Values Function + Default Factory Action → Only the action is executed, but no default values are set.

  • Default Factory Action + Augmentation → Only the action is executed, but no default values are set.

👉In practice, always choose one method per entity.

⚠️The above results are based on my own testing, not on official documentation. There may be inaccuracies.

 

Sample Code

In all of the following examples, the root entity is Employee and the child entity is Address.
Each method demonstrates how to set default values for Employee as well as for Address (when applicable).

1. Default Values Function

Behavior Definition

Define default values functions. 

Note: GetDefaultsForCreate is the predefined function name and can be omitted.

  // Default values for the root entity  
  create {default function GetDefaultsForCreate; }

  // Default values for the child entity (via create-by-association)  
  association _Address {create {default function GetDefaultsForCBA;}  with draft;}

Behavior Projection

Expose default values functions.

  use function GetDefaultsForCreate;
  use function GetDefaultsForCBA;

Behavior Implementation

  METHOD GetDefaultsForCreate.
    result = value #( for key in keys (
               %cid = key-%cid
               %param-LastName = 'Default Last Name'
                ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD GetDefaultsForCBA.
    result = value #( for key in keys (
                      %tky = key-%tky
                      %param-Purpose = 'Default Purpose'
                    ) ).
  ENDMETHOD.

 

2. Default Factory Action

Behavior Definition

Define a default factory action. In this example, an input parameter ZABS_EMPLOYEE_INPUT is used. If no input is required, the parameter can be omitted.

static default factory action MyDefaultActionForCreate parameter ZABS_EMPLOYEE_INPUT [1];

ZABS_EMPLOYEE_INPUT is defined as a CDS abstract entity.

@EndUserText.label: 'Input for employee default action'
define abstract entity ZABS_EMPLOYEE_INPUT
{
    @EndUserText.label: 'Employee Type'
    EmployeeType: abap.int1;    
}

Behavior Projection

Expose the default factory action.

  use action MyDefaultActionForCreate;

Behavior Implementation

  METHOD MyDefaultActionForCreate.
    DATA employee_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508.
    DATA employee_create_line TYPE STRUCTURE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508.
    DATA address_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508\_Address.
    DATA address_create_line TYPE STRUCTURE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508\_Address.

    LOOP AT keys INTO DATA(key).
      " Set default data for Employee
      employee_create_line = VALUE #(
        %cid = key-%cid
        %is_draft = key-%param-%is_draft
        FirstName = SWITCH #( key-%param-EmployeeType
                              WHEN 1 THEN 'Default 1'
                              WHEN 2 THEN 'Default 2'
                              WHEN 3 THEN '' )
        %control = VALUE #( FirstName = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
       ).
      APPEND employee_create_line TO employee_create.

      " Set default data for Address
      address_create_line = VALUE #(
       %cid_ref = key-%cid
       %is_draft = key-%param-%is_draft
       %target = VALUE #( ( %cid = sy-tabix
                            %is_draft = key-%param-%is_draft
                            Purpose = 'Default'
                            %control = VALUE #( Purpose = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ) ) )
      ).
      APPEND address_create_line TO address_create.
    ENDLOOP.

    "Create new instance of Employee
    MODIFY ENTITIES OF zr_employee_2508 IN LOCAL MODE
      ENTITY Employee
      CREATE FROM employee_create
      CREATE BY \_Address
      FROM address_create
      MAPPED DATA(mapped_create).

    mapped-employee = mapped_create-employee.
    mapped-address = mapped_create-Address.

  ENDMETHOD.

 

3. Augmentation

Behavior Projection

Augmentations are defined only in the Behavior Projection. The keyword "augment" is used to define them.

  // Default values for the root entity  
  use create (augment);

  // Default values for the child entity (via create-by-association)  
  use association _Address {create (augment); with draft;}

Behavior Implementation

  METHOD augment_create.
    DATA employee_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508.
    DATA address_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508\_Address.
    DATA address_create_line TYPE STRUCTURE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508\_Address.
    DATA relates_create TYPE abp_behv_relating_tab.
    DATA tabix TYPE sy-tabix.

    employee_create = CORRESPONDING #( entities ).

    LOOP AT employee_create ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<employee>).
      " Count table index for generating unique %cid for Address
      tabix = sy-tabix.
      APPEND tabix TO relates_create.

      " Set Default Data for Employee
      <employee>-DateOfBirth = '19900101'.
      <employee>-%control-DateOfBirth = if_abap_behv=>mk-on.

      " Set Default Data for Address
      address_create_line = VALUE #( %cid_ref = <employee>-%cid
                     %is_draft = <employee>-%is_draft
                     %key = <employee>-%key
                     %target = VALUE #( ( %cid = tabix
                                          %is_draft = <employee>-%is_draft
                                          Purpose = 'Augmented Address'
                                          %control = VALUE #( Purpose = if_abap_behv=>mk-on )
                                        ) )
                     ).
      APPEND address_create_line TO address_create.
    ENDLOOP.

    MODIFY AUGMENTING ENTITIES OF zr_employee_2508
      ENTITY Employee
      CREATE FROM employee_create
      CREATE BY \_Address
      FROM address_create
      RELATING TO entities BY relates_create.
  ENDMETHOD.

  METHOD augment_cba_Address.
    DATA address_create TYPE TABLE FOR CREATE zr_employee_2508\_Address.
    DATA relates_update TYPE abp_behv_relating_tab.

    address_create = CORRESPONDING #( DEEP entities ).

    LOOP AT address_create ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<address>).
      LOOP AT <address>-%target ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<target>).
        <target>-Purpose = 'Augmented Address CBA'.
        <target>-%control = VALUE #( Purpose = if_abap_behv=>mk-on ).
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDLOOP.

    MODIFY AUGMENTING ENTITIES OF zr_employee_2508
      ENTITY Employee
      CREATE BY \_Address
      FROM address_create.

  ENDMETHOD.

 

Conclusion

When setting default values in RAP, you can choose between Default Values Function, Default Factory Action, and Augmentation.

  • Use Default Values Function for static defaults.

  • Use Default Factory Action for dynamic defaults or when creating child entities together with the root.

  • Use Augmentation only at the projection layer, when the base behavior cannot be changed.

 Since these methods cannot be combined for the same entity, always pick the one that best matches your scenario.

References

  • Operation Defaulting (Default Values Function) | SAP Help Portal
  • RAP - Default Factory Action  | ABAP Keyword Documentation
  • Editing Text for Supplements (Augmentation) | SAP Help Portal

entry.title: Re: CRM (C1P) - /dev/shm Mount Point Full on wkaws1033
entry.content:
Hi @PradeepKumar04 

The /dev/shm mount point getting full on your SAP CRM additional application server host often indicates shared memory usage issues. /dev/shm is a temporary file storage that resides in RAM and is commonly used for Inter-Process Communication such as semaphores and shared memory segments.

Here are the Common Root Causes:

  1. Unreleased Shared Memory Segments:
    Processes may create shared memory or semaphores but fail to release them properly after completion, causing /dev/shm to fill up.
  2. High Volume of Processes Using /dev/shm:
    Intensive applications or batch jobs may create large or numerous shared memory objects.
  3. Leaks in SAP or OS Resources:
    A bug or misconfiguration in SAP CRM or the underlying OS causing memory leaks in shared memory.
  4. Insufficient /dev/shm Size Configuration:
    The size for /dev/shm may be set too low relative to the RAM or workload requirements.

Here are recommended Checks and Actions:

  • Check your Shared Memory Usage:
    Run the following:

bash

df -h /dev/shm

ipcs -m    # List current shared memory segments

ipcs -s    # List semaphores

Identify orphaned or excessive segments.

  • Clear Stale Shared Memory:
    If you find shared memory segments belonging to processes no longer running, ensure you remove them manually using:

bash

ipcrm -m <shmid>

ipcrm -s <semid>

Be cautious and validate ownership before cleanup.

  • Check SAP Notes:
    There are SAP Notes related to /dev/shm not being released properly, e.g.
    SAP Note 706071  Linux: Memory in tmpfs is not released correctly
    SAP Note 1674325 DEV/SHM directory is used by multiple instances and prevents startup
  • Verify OS Limits and Configuration:
    Ensure /dev/shm size is configured appropriately in /etc/fstab or systemd tmpfs config, e.g. size=<suitable size>:

bash

mount | grep /dev/shm

Typical size is half the RAM or more depending on workload.

  • Monitor Processes in SAP:
    Look for hung or stuck SAP processes using transaction SM50/SM66 that might be holding IPC resources.
  • Restart SAP Instances Carefully:
    Sometimes, a restart may be needed to free IPC resources if manual cleanup is not feasible.

I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Vertex Tax Integration – Restrict Usage to Sales Tran...
entry.content:
Hello @Govind_Sharma 

Thank you for your enquiry regarding tax calculation and the use of user exits in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud Edition.

The  user exits, such as EXIT_SAPLFYTX_USER_001 or BADI_MRM_TAX_CALCULATION, are not available—these are specific to on-premise or private edition systems. Instead, tax control is managed via scope selection and configuration activities.

Key Points:

Restrict Vertex to Sales only:

    • In Central Business Configuration (CBC), scope only External Tax Calculation – Sales, and do not scope the Procurement variant.
    • In the External Tax Calculation (SSCUI) configuration, set:
      • Application Area = SD (Sales) → External
      • Application Area = MM (Purchasing) → Internal
    • Ensure the SD tax procedure includes external tax condition types (e.g., UTXJ), while the MM tax procedure uses standard internal conditions.
    • Result: Vertex is invoked only for sales documents; procurement documents continue to use SAP’s internal tax logic.c.

Fixing Zero Tax on Customer Invoices:

    • A zero-tax amount from Vertex usually signals data issues, not connectivity.
    • Validate:
      • Address and jurisdiction data completeness for Ship-to party, Plant, and Company Code.
      • Pricing procedure includes the external tax condition, is not statistical, and contains an account key for posting.
      • Customer and material tax classifications are accurate (not exempt).
      • Vertex configuration mappings for company, registration, and products are correct and active, with no exemptions inadvertently applied.
    • Use the External Tax Calculation Log in SAP S/4HANA Cloud to check if the Vertex call succeeded and review returned tax rates.

Preventing Vertex Calls for Purchasing:

    • No user exits required.
    • Handled automatically by associating only the internal tax procedure for MM in the SSCUI configuration.
    • Vendor invoices and purchase orders thus use SAP internal tax calculation, and Vertex is bypassed.

The SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud manages tax integration through scope selection and SSCUI configuration, not via user exits or BADIs. Correctly setting the scope and configuration ensures Vertex is restricted to sales documents only. Most tax issues typically originate from master data or configuration errors rather than integration problems.

 

With kind regards

Chuma

 

 

GenIA Assist content

Helpful SAP Documentation References for You:

  • SAP Help: External Tax Calculation in SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • SAP API Business Hub: Vertex Tax Integration Flows for SAP S/4HANA Cloud
  • Vertex: Vertex Resource Library

entry.title: Re: Cross-Company Code Cash Application – Withholding Tax...
entry.content:
Hello @R_Pooja 

The error message "Company Codes have different settings for withholding tax treatment" is normal in SAP S/4HANA public cloud. Automatic clearing between company codes is not available if they have different withholding tax configurations.

Reasons why this occurs,

When processing payments, the system verifies consistency in withholding tax settings across company codes. If, for example, company code DE01 and company code FR01 have different withholding tax parameters such as indicators or calculation methods, the system prevents the direct clearing process. This restriction aims to avoid inconsistent accounting postings caused by mismatched tax treatments.

Your current workaround:

Posting the bank statement on the account in DE01 and manually clearing it against the invoice in FR01 aligns with SAP’s standard behaviour in these scenarios and is the recommended method.

Possible solutions:

  • Standard SAP behaviour: There is no configuration option to override this check. This is documented in KBA 2186938, which applies to both on-premises and cloud editions.
  • Best practice: Align withholding tax configurations across all involved company codes, ensuring uniform withholding tax types and calculation methods. Once harmonised, the system will allow cross-company code clearing without errors.
  • Automation options in Public Cloud:
    • Use Advanced Bank Statement Processing (scope item 1EG) with posting rules to streamline posting bank statements and reduce manual clearing steps.
    • Consider Central Payments (scope item 1S4) in a Central Finance scenario, designed to handle cross-company receivables and payables more efficiently.

Please take a moment to review the helpful SAP documentation below

  • SAP Help App: Check Withholding Tax Settings and Simulate Calculation
  • SAP Help: Clearing Withholding Tax Items

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: मैं फ्लिपकार्ट से शिकायत कैसे करूं?
entry.content: फ्लिपकार्ट में शिकायत दर्ज करने के लिए, आप ग्राहक सेवा से संपर्क कर सकते हैं,070917-38237 ऐप या वेबसाइट पर शिकायत दर्ज कर सकते हैं, या सोशल मीडिया पर शिकायत कर सकते हैं. आप शिकायत अधिकारी को ईमेल भी कर सकते हैं या उपभोक्ता हेल्पलाइन में शिकायत दर्ज कर सकते हैं.

entry.title: Optimizing Asset Maintenance process in SAP S4HANA with Resource Scheduling
entry.content:
In this blog, I will be walking through how we can handle the resource scheduling for maintenance orders that are part of Phase Based Maintenance framework.

My Business Use Case:

My organization is a Calcined Process Industry and follows phase-based maintenance framework for Reactive and Proactive Maintenance activities. Lately, production team reported that the belt conveyor BC01 belt has torn and ripped in raw material handling area, i.e., Coke Pad. So I have created a Reactive Maintenance order for Belt Conveyor(BC01). Also, I do have scheduled Preventive Maintenance orders for Kiln-01, Belt Conveyor(BC02), and Belt Conveyor(BC03).

If you want to gain a deep understanding of Phase-Based maintenance framework, please find the blog links below.

  • Phase-Based Maintenance Process With Lean Services in SAP S4 HANA Asset Management. 

 

  • Let`s get down to nitty-gritty of "Manage Workflows for Maintenance Orders"-S4 HANA Asset Management 

 

  • Planning, Adding & Approving Lean Services Using Flexible Workflow in SAP S/4HANA Asset Management. 

The crux of the SAP S4HANA Asset Management "Resource Scheduling" :

Resource scheduling in SAP S4HANA enables efficient planning of maintenance tasks by providing visibility into workload, capacities, and work center utilization aspects. We can use the apps for resource scheduling to check current and forecasted work center utilization, build schedules, and determine required capacities before dispatching the scheduled work.

Key Benefits Include, but are not limited to:

  • Build an optimal schedule through simulation analysis for open maintenance orders before releasing for execution.
  • Group and Schedule maintenance orders by assets.
  • Control Maintenance Workloads by adjusting activities in the schedule.
  • Distribute Work evenly across capacities and collaborating across other schedulers.

I will be using FIORI Apps listed below for this walk through.

Mini Note: With an additional license, we can use "Resource Scheduling" for maintenance work centers and assign maintenance crew to these work centers. We can dispatch individual order operations and pass the maintenance orders to the "Execution Phase".

First things first...let us "Make Basic Settings for Resource Scheduling" and create a Work Center Team.

Creating work centers team can make planner or supervisor`s job easier, because they can choose suitable team members when they plan maintenance work. A work center can be linked to exactly one team, and a team can be linked to exactly one work center. In addition, a person can only be assigned to one work center team at a time.

For Instance, I have created four teams to represent the Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation, and Safety departments.

Mechanical Team:

Electrical Team:

Instrumentation Team:

Safety Team:

 

The overall teams for Calcination Maintenance are as follows:

 

Now let us get into our Scheduling process. to do so, let us first submit the maintenance orders for scheduling in the "Manage Maintenance Backlog" app. With this action we pass the maintenance orders on to the "Scheduling" phase.

I have created a maintenance planning bucket for Mechanical, Electrical, Instrumentation, and Safety work centers.

Now let us look at the backlog overview.

 

 

Once we are confident that all the required resources will be available on the required dates, we can select individual orders in the "Manage Maintenance Backlog" app and choose submit for scheduling.

Following the successful submission, the system updates the phase status.

 

Now let us view the dashboard using "Resource Scheduling for Maintenance Planners".

 

Now let us assign the person responsible for the maintenance order operations by using the card "Unassigned Work".

Now let us assign the team members to perform the job. Based on the assignment made in the "Manage Teams for Work Center" for the performing work center, the system displays the team members for each performing work center.

For Mechanical Works:

For Electrical Works:

For Instrumentation Works:

For Safety Works:

Once we assign the maintenance team members to the operations, the assignment status changes to "Assigned".

Now let us check the due maintenance order operations by priority.

Now let us add three maintenance orders to the schedule.

We can add the  due maintenance orders to the existing schedule if any, or we can create a new schedule. For Instance let us create a new schedule for the "WEEK 33".

Now the schedule status has changed to "Scoping".

Once all the work orders are assigned to the schedule "2025_CAL_MAINT_WEEK_33",  we can  use "Manage Schedule" to monitor the utilization aspects.

We can visualize the work center utilization by many attributes. For instance, let us consider processing status attribute.

Manage Schedule - List View:

Manage Schedule - Graphical View:

We have a lot many options to visualize the data.

We can change the performing work center.

 

Now let us look at the elephant in the room, i.e., "Maintenance Scheduling Board".

For Instance, let us consider the date range, work centers, and priority as per our maintenance orders.

 

and also let us select the maintenance order operations having status "DUE".

To view the work centers, we can use the option "My Work Centers".

Now let us visualize the data using the option "Orders and Resources".

we can update the constraints( Must Start Date &Time), Change Performing Work Center, Dispatch or Assign/Unassign people for the Maintenance Order Operations.

For Instance, let us update the constraint for one of the operations.

We can assign and unassign the people.

We can move the operations to next week by dragging and dropping to ensure the utilization is not more than 100%.

Now let us maintain the relationships and dispatch the operations.

We can maintain Offset/Edit Offset/Delete Offset, and create "Relationships" between operations. For Instance, let us add "2 HRs" offset to one of the operations.

We can Edit or Delete Offset or Relationship.

Once we dispatch the operations, the maintenance order phase moves to the "Execution Phase" and sub-phase moves to "Ready For Execution (Order)".

Now let us visualize the "Scheduling Overview by Asset Wise". For Instance, let us select "Belt Conveyor-01".

We can visualize an asset in its hierarchical structure. Also, we can graphically view the maintenance work planned for the asset and all its sub-assets.

 

Collaborating on a Schedule: We can share a schedule that we created or review a schedule that someone shared with us. The activity log helps us track the changes made by co-planners and reviewers of our schedule. We can also post and reply to the comments in the log.

As the maintenance orders and operations have been dispatched, let us use app. "Manage Schedule" to visualize the work center utilization and share the schedule.

First visualize the work center utilization by "Processing Status".

Now let us share with one of our peers.

 

Now, "Chandana Chelikam" reviews our schedule and provides her feedback on the schedule completeness by accessing the "Manage Schedules -For Review" app.

 

Now, let us view her feedback (activity log) and reply to her using  "Manage Schedules -For Review" app.

 

Now let us "Freeze" the schedule by choosing "Freeze Schedule" option.

Now the schedule "2025_CAL_MAINT_WEEK_33"  status becomes " FROZEN".

 

Once the schedule is "Frozen", we can no longer change the schedule. If any new operations are added and dispatched to be completed within the schedule after the schedule was frozen, then the status of those operations under "Completion In Schedule" will shown as "Dispatched In Addition".

 

Now let us track the "Execution Of a Schedule".

Once the schedule period starts, the schedule status changes to "Execution". We can start tracking schedule attainment and the completion of the order operations in our schedule. The prerequisite is that the schedule must be "Frozen" before the schedule period starts.

We can track it either using "Manage Schedule app." or "My Schedules" card in the "Resource Scheduling for Maintenance Planners app".

Once we complete the maintenance operations at shop floor, let us confirm the operations using "Perform Maintenance Jobs" app.

For Instance, let us use the option "Quick Confirm".

 

Schedule Attainment: Let us use the "Manage Schedule" app. to view the schedule attainment ratio.

Post maintenance order operations confirmations, The micro chart for the  "Attainment" shows the ratio of the work that was planned for the schedule period  and the work that was completed as planned in the schedule period.

let us visualize the operations completed in schedule between 18.08.2025 to 24.08.2025.

Mini Note: When the operations are not in the schedule at the time of the schedule freeze, and those are dispatched for and completed in the schedule period after the schedule is frozen, the status for those operations is shown as "Completed in Addition".

 

This brings me to the end of my process walk through. 😊 I hope my blog proves useful to the Maintenance Team. I look forward to seeing Maintenance Team using "Resource Scheduling"  functionality to optimize maintenance operations and enhance asset reliability.

 

--

Yours Sincerely,

Pardhasaradhi Reddy.C
